measured_by: D parameter of the Process Dissociation (PD) model
justification: “Sensitivity to harm is conceptualized to guide deontological choices (in the PD model this is reflected with the D parameter…).”

measured_by: N parameter of the CNI model
justification: The text notes that “in the CNI model this is reflected with the N parameter” when describing how deontological sensitivity is captured.

measured_by: U parameter of the Process Dissociation (PD) model
justification: The article states that “Sensitivity to consequences of one's actions is conceptualized to guide utilitarian choices (in the PD model this is reflected with the U parameter…).”

measured_by: C parameter of the CNI model
justification: The same sentence adds that, for the CNI model, utilitarian sensitivity “is reflected with the C parameter.”

measured_by: I parameter of the CNI model
justification: “CNI also includes the inaction (I) parameter. This new parameter is conceptualized to capture the preference for inaction in moral dilemmas.”

measured_by: yes/no or 1-7 Likert ratings in self-sacrificial moral dilemmas
justification: During the experiments “participants were asked whether they would decide to sacrifice themselves (Yes, I would / No, I wouldn't)” and, in later studies, “participants rated their willingness to self-sacrifice ranging from 1 to 7.”
